thread.title: Council hits out at vandals who damaged newly refurbished bandstand | Central
thread.title_full: Council hits out at vandals who damaged newly refurbished bandstand | Central - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Council hits out at vandals who damaged newly refurbished bandstand | Central
text:
Photo of the vandalism at the bandstand in Ilkeston Credit: Erewash Borough Council Erewash Borough Council has hit out at vandals who have damaged the newly refurbished bandstand at Victoria Park in Ilkeston.
The mindless vandals smashed glass panels, damaged paintwork and woodwork during the evening of Sunday 12 February.
The council has leafleted nearby properties asking if anyone saw or heard anything in an attempt to identify the vandals involved.
Photo of the vandalism at the bandstand in Ilkeston Credit: Erewash Borough Council Councillor Mike Wallis, Erewash Borough Council’s Lead Member for Culture and Leisure, says:
I don’t think anyone could find the words that adequately sum up the anger, frustration, disbelief and disappointment we feel at this vandalism. Victoria Park is much loved by the local community and we have received many compliments for the restored key features within the Green Flag park.
We need local people to help us fight this problem – we can’t do it alone. Please be our eyes and ears and tell us or the police if you know who is destroying this historic feature of the park.
– Councillor Mike Wallis East Midlands Derby
